message.content:
cs.DB, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.CR, cs.SE. 

The paper evaluates the analytical capabilities of DataStax Enterprise (DSE) through the use of standard Hadoop workloads. DSE is a distributed database management system based on Apache Cassandra, which is a NoSQL database. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the cs.DB (Databases) sub-category. The experiments involve running CPU and I/O bound micro-benchmarks as well as OLAP-style analytical query workloads, which are related to distributed computing and data processing. Hence, the paper could also belong to the cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the use of the Cassandra File System (CFS), which supports the Hadoop Distributed File System API, and the seamless integration of Hadoop stack applications in DSE. This aspect is related to system architecture and design, which could place the paper in the cs.CR (Hardware Architecture) sub-category. Finally, the paper presents a benchmark methodology and evaluates the results of the experiments, which are related to software engineering and performance evaluation, respectively. Therefore, the paper could also belong to the cs.SE (Software Engineering) sub-category.
